http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Journalism III is a two-semester course designed to immerse students in the production process through an advanced study of media production. Students will employ journalistic skills in media. Students will use academic knowledge gained in Journalism I and II to assume leadership roles and/or become advanced writers, designers, and photographers. Writing, technology, and visual and electronic media are used as tools for learning as students create, critique, and produce. Students will adhere to journalistic guidelines for writing and design, which include objectivity, responsibility, and credibility.
Law and Ethics
Students will evaluate legal and ethical issues.
Evaluate legal and ethical concepts in journalistic works
Evaluate various legal restrictions placed on the press and electronic media
Apply ethical responsibilities to journalistic work
History
Students will develop knowledge of the history and role of journalism in society.
Evaluate the role of journalism in a democratic society
Analyze the effectiveness of journalism in contemporary society
Evaluate photography in contemporary journalism

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: (e.g., emotional connection, how photos enhance text, reader response, storytelling quality of the photo)

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Management and Organization
Students will demonstrate a working knowledge of staff management and organization.
Evaluate staff organizational and time management strategies necessary to meet production schedules
Evaluate the existing staff plan for financing media productions
Evaluate the existing staff plan to maximize the circulation of the media
Design and Production
Students will create designs for media.
Evaluate available technologies used in publishing to create appropriate media
Apply appropriate advanced design principles and trends for media production

http://purl.org/ASN/schema/core/comment.value: (e.g., color harmony, grid layout, special graphic effects, typography, Web design)

http://purl.org/dc/terms/description.value: Evaluate content for selected media through reporting, writing, editing, photography, layout, and design
Writing
Students will create various pieces of journalistically sound writing.
Evaluate original interview questions using advanced research skills in various forms of writing
Compose various forms of journalistically sound writing suitable for publication
Revise various forms of journalistically sound writing suitable for publication

Edit various forms of writing suitable for a journalistically sound publication:
  • peer edit
  • self-edit
Photography
Students will demonstrate a working knowledge of photographic principles.
Integrate appropriate photographic pieces into media
Evaluate the role of photojournalism within media
